column4: hi everybody. I just set up a computer with the latest version of Ubuntu and all my fonts lack "crispness" (for lack of a better word). they look kind of blurred. any idea of what might be causing this?
System>Preferences>Appearance Fonts Tab tweak the rendering settings maybe that helps
newer xorg releases do not need a xorg.conf to work; so none is there by default. if one is present it is used though
ok, but then were is the current X config written?
it is in Xoerg memory. if you do "sudo Xorg -configure" it is written to /root/ iirc
you have to stop the xerver first afaik
yes. how do I do that?  ctrl+alt+backspace does not work any more

it did create a fjle under /root/xorg.conf .I have to tell you that I am using a live-CD of Xubuntu. I am trying to find a way to transfer the values of X under the Xubuntu live-CD to my hard drive X config.  Is that possible?  (In the good old days, all which was needed was copy xorg.
as i said if it is in /etc/X11/xorg.conf it will be used
